page.title: 04BRADLEY HALL, DAIRY FARM
page.content: Bradley Hall dairy farm is located at Grappenhall near the junction of the A5O and M6, just North of the M56. Three people work on the farm, the farmer, his brother and one hired person. The farm is 67.4 hectares in area. The land is gently undulating and the soil is heavy clay with some loam. The land is drained by Bradley Brook and no artificial drainge is used. The farmer improves the soil by putting cow manure and fertilizer on it. The livestock consists of 161 Freisian cows, 1O Murray Greys, and 2 Murray bulls. The Murrays are mainly for showing, but the main income on the farm is from milk production.
